name: James B. GALLARDY, Appellant, v. Lloyd Clair ASHCRAFT and Nancy Ann Ashcraft, his wife

judges: Before O’BRIEN, C. J., and ROBERTS, NIX, LARSEN, FLAHERTY, McDERMOTT and HUTCHINSON, JJ.
parties: James B. GALLARDY, Appellant, v. Lloyd Clair ASHCRAFT and Nancy Ann Ashcraft, his wife.

opinions.text:
ORDER
PER CURIAM:
Appeal is dismissed as having been improvidently granted.
opinions.author: PER CURIAM:

attorneys: Francis J. Leahey, Jr., Ebensburg, George Gvozdich, Jr., for appellant.
Robert B. Mitinger, Jr., Miller, Kistler & Campbell, Bellefonte, for appellees.
casebody.head_matter:
442 A.2d 693
James B. GALLARDY, Appellant, v. Lloyd Clair ASHCRAFT and Nancy Ann Ashcraft, his wife.
Supreme Court of Pennsylvania.
Argued March 2, 1982.
Decided April 2, 1982.
Francis J. Leahey, Jr., Ebensburg, George Gvozdich, Jr., for appellant.
Robert B. Mitinger, Jr., Miller, Kistler & Campbell, Bellefonte, for appellees.
Before O’BRIEN, C. J., and ROBERTS, NIX, LARSEN, FLAHERTY, McDERMOTT and HUTCHINSON, JJ.
